description: The index to identifying a PW within the system.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlIndex

description: Time stamp attribute set at the end of a command.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlTimestamp

description: This object is set by the operator to indicate the PSN type.
Based on this object, the relevant PSN table's entry is created in the PSN specific MIB modules.
NOTE:
R4.0/R4.7M support only mpls(1).
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwPsnType

description: This object defines the relative priority of the PW during set-up in a lowest-to-highest fashion,
where 0 is the highest priority. PWs with the same priority are treated with equal priority.
PW that have not yet succeeded to set-up will report 'dormant' in the pwOperStatus.
This value is significant if there are competing resources among PWs and the implementation support
this feature. Equal priority handling with competing resources is implementation specific.
This object MAY be changed at any time.
NOTE:
R4.0/R4.7M support only priority 0.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwSetUpPriority

description: This object defines the relative holding priority of the PW in a lowest-to-highest fashion,
where 0 is the highest priority. PWs with the same priority are treated equally.
This value is significant if there are competing resources among PWs and the implementation support
this feature. Equal priority handling with competing resources is implementation specific.
This object MAY be changed only if the PW is not active.
NOTE:
R4.0/R4.7M support only priority 0.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwHoldingPriority

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It should be set to 'unknown' if PE/PW maintenance
protocol is not used and the address is unknown.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address
of the PW/PE maintenance protocol entity. This object
SHOULD contain a value of all zeroes if not applicable (pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
The parameter could only be set with create command and could not be modified!
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwPeerAddr

description: If the PW is attached to another PW instead of a local native service, this item indicates
the pwIndex of the attached PW. Otherwise, this object MUST be set to zero.
Attachment to another PW will have no PW specific entry in any of the service MIB modules.
Should always be 0 with R4.xM.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwAttachedPwIndex

description: Pseudowire identifier.
If the pwOwner object is 'pwIdFecSignaling' or 'l2tpControlProtocol', then this object is signaled
in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual Circuit FEC Element'. For other values of pwOwner
this object is not signaled and it MAY be set to zero.
For implementations that support the pwIndexMappingTable, a non-zero value is RECOMMENDED, even if
this identifier is not signaled. This is so that reverse mappings can be provided by
pwIndexMappingTable and pwPeerMappingTable.
It is therefore RECOMMENDED that the value of this pwID be unique (or if pwPeerAddrType is not
'unknown', at least [pwType,pwID,pwPeerAddrType,pwPeerAddr] is unique.)
NOTE:
R4.0M will not accept a configuration of the pwId parameter!
The pwId of a new created pwTable entry will base on the VpnInstance assignment(shePwTableControlExtVcVpnInstance).
Therefore the associated sheVpnTable entry should be created first and the parameter sheVpnId must be
valueable! The pwId will be equal to this sheVpnId!
NOTE:
R4.7M will now accept a configuration of the pwId parameter but could only be set during create command!
The parameter could not be modified!
The pwId equal sheVpnId will be still the default behavior if not set during create.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwId

description: Used in the Group ID field sent to the peer PWES within the maintenance protocol used for PW setup.
It SHOULD be set to zero if maintenance protocol is not used.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwLocalGroupID

description: This object is an octet string representing the attachment group identifier (AGI) that this
PW belongs too, which typically identifies the VPN ID.
Applicable only if pwOwner equal 'genFecSignaling'.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwGroupAttachmentID

description: This object is an octet string representing the local forwarder attachment individual identifier
(AII) to be used by this PW. It is used as the SAII for outgoing signaling messages and the TAII
in the incoming messages from the peer.
Applicable only if pwOwner equal 'genFecSignaling'.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwLocalAttachmentID

description: This object is an octet string representing the remote forwarder attachment individual identifier
(AII) to be used by this PW. It is used as the TAII for outgoing signaling messages and the SAII
in the incoming messages from the peer.
Applicable only if pwOwner equal 'genFecSignaling'.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwRemoteAttachmentID

description: The PW label used in the outbound direction (i.e. toward the PSN).
It might be set manually if pwOwner is 'manual', otherwise setting done automatically.
For MPLS, MPLS over IP or MPLS over GRE PSN, it represents the 20 bits of PW tag, for L2TP
it represents the 32 bits Session ID and for IP PSN it represents the destination UDP port number.
If the label is not yet known (signaling in process), the object SHOULD return a value
of 0xFFFFFFFF (4294967295).
For manual configuration, this object MAY be changed only if the PW is not active.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwOutboundLabel

description: The PW label used in the inbound direction (i.e. packets received from the PSN).
It may be set manually if pwOwner is 'manual',otherwise setting done automatically.
For MPLS, MPLS over IP or MPLS over GRE PSN, it represents the 20 bits of PW tag, for L2TP
it represents the 32 bits Session ID and for IP PSN it represents the source UDP port number.
If the label is not yet known (signaling in process), the object SHOULD return a value
of 0xFFFFFFFF (4294967295).
For manual configuration, this object MAY be changed only if the PW is not active.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwInboundLabel

description: The desired operational status of this PW.
This object MAY be set at any time.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlPwAdminStatus

description: look at table
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlExtVcVpnInstance

description: look at table.

to VcRedGroup-Instance which must be also assigned to the same Vpn-Instance!
NOTE2:
NO support with R4.0M.
Support start with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlExtVcGroupInstance

description: look at table.
NOTE:
NO support with R4.0M.
Support start with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-PW-EXT-MIB::shePwTableControlExtVcPreferentialForwardingStatus

Used to indentify this pw on CLI interface and must therefore be unique.
New with R4.7M and only for create command!

word.

description: This parameter report the operational state of a shePwVcRedGroup.
State 'notused(3)' should be reported as long as no shePwExt-instances
referencing this shePwVcRedGroup.
The state is 'up(1)' as long as one referencing shePwExt instance is running.
The state is 'down(2)' if all referencing shePwExt-instances are down.

description: The attribute provides the reference and the mapping to the corresponding VPWS instance
(supplementing the function of the Attachment Circuit).
NOTE:
This reference is an r/o - attribute and the value will be deduced from the relationship
provided by the configuration of the Internal Ethernet Transport, i.e. there is no risk
of inconsistent settings of the Ethernet path (Internal Ethernet Transport) and the
ATM path (PW ATM Configuration Objects).
